intro: Muilla tenuis, commonly known as the slender muilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Muilla tenuis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
